intro: Codonanthe digna, commonly known as the sacred violet, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Violaceae family, which includes many species of violets and related plants. The plant is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and cultural significance, it is often cultivated in tropical gardens.
